billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CORPORATIONS, AUTHORITIES AND COMMISSIONS

title: Relates to the membership of the New York city water board; repealer
summary: Relates to the membership of the New York city water board.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1527

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. PERKINS -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Corporations,  Authorities
         and Commissions

       AN  ACT  to amend the public authorities law, in relation to the member-
         ship of  the  New  York  city  water  board;  and  to  repeal  certain
         provisions of such law relating thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 2 of section 1045-f of the  public  authorities
    2  law is REPEALED and a new subdivision 2 is added to read as follows:
    3    2.  A. THE WATER BOARD SHALL CONSIST OF SEVEN MEMBERS TO BE APPOINTED,
    4  AS FOLLOWS:
    5    (I) FOUR MEMBERS APPOINTED BY THE MAYOR;
    6    (II) ONE MEMBER APPOINTED BY THE NEW YORK CITY COMPTROLLER;
    7    (III) ONE MEMBER APPOINTED BY THE PUBLIC ADVOCATE FOR THE CITY OF  NEW
    8  YORK; AND
    9    (IV) ONE MEMBER APPOINTED BY THE SPEAKER OF THE NEW YORK CITY COUNCIL.
   10    B.  TERMS  OF  OFFICE  OF THE MEMBERS SHALL BE TWO YEARS. AT LEAST ONE
   11  MEMBER APPOINTED BY THE MAYOR SHALL HAVE EXPERIENCE IN  THE  SCIENCE  OF
   12  WATER RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT. NO MEMBER SHALL BE A DIRECTOR OF THE AUTHOR-
   13  ITY.  THE  CHAIRMAN  SHALL BE ELECTED BY MAJORITY VOTE OF THE MEMBERS OF
   14  THE BOARD. ALL MEMBERS SHALL CONTINUE TO HOLD OFFICE UNTIL THEIR SUCCES-
   15  SORS ARE APPOINTED AND QUALIFIED.  VACANCIES  SHALL  BE  FILLED  IN  THE
   16  MANNER  PROVIDED  FOR ORIGINAL APPOINTMENTS. VACANCIES, OCCURRING OTHER-
   17  WISE THAN BY EXPIRATION OF TERM OF OFFICE, SHALL BE FILLED IN  THE  SAME
   18  MANNER AS ORIGINAL APPOINTMENTS FOR THE UNEXPIRED TERMS.
   19    S  2.  Subdivisions  3,  4,  5  and  7 of section 1045-f of the public
   20  authorities law, as added by chapter  513  of  the  laws  of  1984,  are
   21  amended to read as follows:
   22    3.  Each  member of the water board shall be entitled to reimbursement
   23  for his OR HER actual and necessary expenses incurred in the performance

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1  of his OR HER official duties and a per diem allowance  of  one  hundred
    2  fifty  dollars  when  rendering  service  as a member; provided that the
    3  aggregate of such per diem allowance to any one member in any one fiscal
    4  year of the board shall not exceed the sum of five thousand dollars.
    5    4. Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of law, general, special
    6  or  local, or any city charter, no officer or employee of the city shall
    7  be deemed to have forfeited or shall forfeit his office or employment or
    8  any benefits provided under the retirement and social security  law,  by
    9  reason  of  his  OR  HER  acceptance  of  membership on the water board,
   10  provided, however, that a member of the board  who  holds  other  public
   11  office  or  employment  shall  receive  no  additional  compensation for
   12  services rendered pursuant to this  title,  but  shall  be  entitled  to
   13  reimbursement  for  his OR HER actual and necessary expenses incurred in
   14  the performance of such services.
   15    5. The [mayor] APPOINTING AUTHORITY may remove [any member] HIS OR HER
   16  APPOINTEE for inefficiency, neglect of  duty  or  misconduct  in  office
   17  after  giving  such member a copy of the charges against such member and
   18  an opportunity to be heard and defended, in person or by  counsel,  upon
   19  not  less  than ten days' notice. If any member shall be so removed, the
   20  [mayor] APPOINTING AUTHORITY shall file in the office of  the  clerk  of
   21  the  city  a  complete statement of charges against such member, and the
   22  [mayor's] APPOINTING  AUTHORITY'S  findings  thereon,  together  with  a
   23  complete record of the proceedings.
   24    7.  A  majority  of  the members of the water board shall constitute a
   25  quorum for the transaction of any business or the exercise of any  power
   26  of the board. The water board shall have power to act by the affirmative
   27  vote  of  not  less than a majority of the members in office at any duly
   28  held meeting thereof. The water board may delegate to one or more of its
   29  members or its officers, agents and employees, such powers and duties as
   30  it may deem proper. Any member who is an officer of  the  city  may,  by
   31  written  instrument,  filed  with  and approved as to form by the board,
   32  designate another city officer to perform in [his] THE MEMBER'S  absence
   33  his  OR  HER  duties under this title. The term "member" as used in this
   34  section shall include such persons so  designated  as  provided  herein.
   35  The  designation  of  any such person shall be deemed temporary only and
   36  shall not affect the civil service or retirement rights of the person so
   37  designated.
   38    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that  the  first
   39  three  vacancies after the effective date of this act shall be filled by
   40  the New York city comptroller, the public advocate for the city  of  New
   41  York  and the speaker of the New York city council, respectively, pursu-
   42  ant to section one of this act.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to the membership of the New York city water board; and to repeal certain provisions of such law relating thereto
